data.title: Improve empty while loop performance in the lwjgl backend
Setup-UI not creating iOS project anymore (latest nightly)
data.body:
Helllo everybody,

I've just downloaded the setup-ui of the latest nightly build and am experiencing some issues when creating a new project.

Usually, the setup-ui created a "MyProject-ios" folder containing the necessary build stuff. Using the nightly build from March 31st, the setup-ui doesn't create this folder anymore.
Also, the setup-ui just shows me that it's planning to create the base project, android, html, robovom as well as a "prj-ios" folder. But this one isn't created either.

Hope it's not an issue caused by me...

data.title: Gradle with intellij problem evaluating root project: Seems to be RoboVM
data.body:
So I've tested this on a couple different project setups and have noticed that it happens everytime that no matter what platform I try to compile for I receive this error,

```
Error:(82, 0) Gradle: A problem occurred evaluating root project 'beta_runner'.
> com/github/jtakakura/gradle/plugins/robovm/RoboVMPlugin : Unsupported major.minor version 51.0

It appears to be an issue with RoboVMPlugin, I have no idea if this is widespread or an isolated case though.
```

data.title: added PolygonRegionLoader for the AssetManager
data.body:
I felt like it may be useful, so I added the PolygonRegionLoader [from libgdx-utils](https://bitbucket.org/dermetfan/libgdx-utils/src/fe0bce159517de10c7aa097ae2e2069f88f7c09f/src/main/net/dermetfan/utils/libgdx/PolygonRegionLoader.java?at=default). I also added it to the default loaders of the AssetManager in its constructor.

The PolygonRegionLoader uses the com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.g2d.PolygonRegionLoader but is an AssetLoader. The line starting with "i " (can be configured using PolygonRegionParameters) in PSH files is used to figure out which Texture it depends on. If that line does not exist, a sibling of the PSH file with the same name and an image file name extension (like "png", "jpeg", ... can be configured) is searched.

data.title: 0.9.9 freetype rendering issue
data.body:
After loading the game everything is working but if the phone screen is locked and then resumed, font rendering is all wrong. But if I quit and restart the game again font is okay.
But the situation repeats if the phone screen locks again.

data.title: Libgdx android native crash
data.body:
Hi, 
I use today's nightly (31/3). 
What happens is that I run a Libgdx Activity (from an android Activity) and it runs fine. Than I finish the Libgdx Activity and I start it again and it crashes... This happens a lot but not all the time. 
In debug mode it doesn't happen at all. Any ideas? It doesn't print any crash log but I think it has something to do with this log: http://pastebin.com/3BFrjbES

My code doesn't do any thing special right now. It's just printing the FPS in a stage....

Some times I get this error before the previous log: EGL error: EGL_BAD_CONTEXT

I tried running it with the stable version and it seems to work ok. But when I changed to use OpenGL ES 2.0 it started doing it again.

data.title: Stage2D SelectBox setSelectedIndex shows not up initially
Fix unwanted visuals on touch up outside of tap area
data.body: So, if one taps a button, drags pointer outside of tap area and releases it then unwanted visual feedback will be shown. See: https://www.dropbox.com/s/3r27s21fxnhmyvv/2014-03-31%2010.10.22.mp4

data.title: iOS backend getDensity() doesn't match other backends
data.body:
Graphics interface's Javadoc says:

> This is a scaling factor for the Density Independent Pixel unit, following the same conventions as android.util.DisplayMetrics#density, where one DIP is one pixel on an approximately 160 dpi screen. Thus on a 160dpi screen this density value will be 1; on a 120 dpi screen it would be .75; etc.

But on iOS backend it says:

> Returns the display density. @return 1.0f for non-retina devices, 2.0f for retina devices.

Usually programmer works with `Graphics` interface (via `Gdx.graphics`), so without explicit cast to `IOGraphics` he can't see appropriate Javadoc for this method in his IDE. 
I think there are two ways to fix this situation: add iOS-specific note to main Javadoc (not so cool) or to unify behavior of `getDensity()`, so this code running on iPad 2 will return 0.825 etc.

data.title: ScrollPane within ScrollPane not working
data.body:
A ScrollPane in a ScrollPane does not work because cancelTouchFocusedChild (in ScrollPane Pan event handler) ends up being called for both ScrollPanes which prevents all subsequent Pan events from being handled.

Both ScrollPanes get the initial Pan event because it is sent based on a snapshot of the focused Actors (see Stage.java SnapshotArray<TouchFocus> touchFocuses = this.touchFocuses;)

More information and sample code to reproduce the bug are here: http://www.badlogicgames.com/forum/viewtopic.php?t=13468&p=59351

data.title: Bullet: update to SWIG 3.0
data.body:
Don't look at the diff, it's huge and might crash your browser, instead look at the individual commits.
This breaks existing API (although it only requires fixing imports).

A week or two ago [SWIG 3.0](http://sourceforge.net/p/swig/news/2014/03/swig-300-released/) is released. The (for the bullet wrapper) most important change is that nested classes are now supported. This is great, because bullet is full of nested classes and up until now we had to manually create a workaround for each nested class. This PR removes all previous workarounds and relies on SWIG to implement those, including all nested classes which where previously not included in the wrapper.

This means that some classes are now moved to be a subclass, meaning you might need to fix your imports. It would be possible to fall back to the previous behavior (`flatnested`), but that might cause naming conflicts and I think it's also cleaner this way.

There seems to be a problem though with directors (callback classes) where the method contains a nested class as an argument. It looks like a jni method signature problem (in `jenv->GetStaticMethodID`), I haven't found a solution for this and therefor "flattened" some director classes of btCollisionWorld (see `jni/swig/collision/btCollisionWorld.i` for details). In practice this means that you don't have to fix the import of these classes.

Someone decided that it would be a good idea to extend stl exceptions in swig. I don't think its worth it to workaround that (would get messy), instead we might as well deal with it and enable stl in the android build. For now, I simply modified `Application.mk`, but of-course that will overwritten when BulletBuild is run. It might be better to add e.g. an option to jnigen to enable stl. Note that actual required changes dont have to match my changes to application.mk (e.g. stl/gnu/static, stl might imply exceptions, etc). Compiling bullet for android takes ages, so I haven't compared each configuration.

Tested on windows and android.

data.title: OrthogonalTiledMapRenderer render ordering is inverted
Gradle: gwt:dist not generating reflection cache
data.body: Need to find out which task triggers running the reflection cache generator and make sure it gets calling during the dist task.

data.title: Out of memory on ObjectIntMap
data.body:
Sometimes occasionally, after long time, I get out of memory error (heap space) with this code

```
if(map.size<10000)
    map.put(b, dmg);
```

The exception

```
java.lang.OutOfMemoryError: Java heap space
    at com.badlogic.gdx.utils.ObjectIntMap.resize(ObjectIntMap.java:465) ~[gdx.jar:?]
    at com.badlogic.gdx.utils.ObjectIntMap.putStash(ObjectIntMap.java:264) ~[gdx.jar:?]
    at com.badlogic.gdx.utils.ObjectIntMap.push(ObjectIntMap.java:258) ~[gdx.jar:?]
    at com.badlogic.gdx.utils.ObjectIntMap.put(ObjectIntMap.java:149) ~[gdx.jar:?]
```

weird, as even 10000 objects shouldn't make out of memory error.
after this error, if I access the map, I get something like this

```
java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException: 100489219
        at com.badlogic.gdx.utils.ObjectIntMap$Entries.next(ObjectIntMap.java:637) ~[gdx.jar:?]
        at com.badlogic.gdx.utils.ObjectIntMap$Entries.next(ObjectIntMap.java:1) ~[gdx.jar:?]
```

Now I know... arrays of size ~100489219 a few times might cause out of memory.
But with less than 10k objects in map, this shouldn't be that big.

Bug, perhaps?

data.title: Bullet - weird behaviour on Mac OS X
data.body:
Latest nightlies, build fresh from build server or build locally. BulletTestLocation exhibits really weird behaviour, stacked blocks explode, cars move on their own etc. Tried different JREs/JDKs (6, 7, 8), same result for all of them. 

Same build works on iOS and Android. Haven't tested on Windows/Linux yet, but i can only imagine it's a Mac specific issue...

data.title: Timers don't work while window doesn't have focus
data.body: On Windows, timers don't seem to work when the window doesn't have focus. On refocusing the window, the timer takes a few seconds to start executing tasks again.

data.title: Support for complex font rendering (Chinese, Arabic, ...)
data.body:
For languages like Chinese, it's not practical for an app to deliver its own font. Therefore there's a desire for libgdx to be able to use fonts delivered by the platform. 

Some discussion already occurred here:
[Roll-your-own Chinese font?](http://www.badlogicgames.com/forum/viewtopic.php?f=11&t=13203)
and here:
[Development Forum: Supporting Asian fonts in BitmapFont](http://www.badlogicgames.com/forum/viewtopic.php?f=23&t=13031)

Earlier attempts at the same challenge have run into difficulties but there doesn't seem to be an exhaustive list of those difficulties. Perhaps that should be compiled here before attempting to develop a new plan.

Box2DDebugRenderer not up to date in GWT backend
data.body:
Trying to compile this: `physicsRenderer = new Box2DDebugRenderer(true, true, true, true, true, true);` results in the following on GWT compile:

> [ERROR] Line 78: The constructor Box2DDebugRenderer(boolean, boolean, boolean, boolean, boolean, boolean) is undefined.

https://github.com/libgdx/libgdx/blob/master/backends/gdx-backends-gwt/src/com/badlogic/gdx/backends/gwt/emu/com/badlogic/gdx/physics/box2d/Box2DDebugRenderer.java#L62

 https://github.com/libgdx/libgdx/blob/master/gdx/src/com/badlogic/gdx/physics/box2d/Box2DDebugRenderer.java#L58

The Box2DDebugRenderer in the GWT backend seems somehow outdated. The c'tor still has only 5 and not 6 parameters.

data.title: inputProcessor seems to be called with latency at startup
data.body:
Hi,
I'm creating an application displaying a splash screen when resources are loaded (using an AssetManager), and I don't want to handle any inputs on the splash screen.
For that I created a dummy implementation of inputprocessor (all method olny return true) to consume all the events and I set it with Gdx.input.setInputProcessor().

My splash screen is rendered multiple time, so my dummy inputprocessor should be called on inputs but it's not. (http://libgdx.badlogicgames.com/nightlies/docs/api/com/badlogic/gdx/Input.html#setInputProcessor%28com.badlogic.gdx.InputProcessor%29)

Once all my resources has been loaded, I set my real inputprocessor, and events which occured during the splash screen are handled by this one, but it should not.

maybe Gdx.input should provide a method to clear occured events?
